name: Up-cycled Antique Victorian Mourning Hair necklace. Edwardian Steampunk
description:
I have a certain fondness for anything that has to deal with mourning hair. I have recently come across this charm of hair in which normally mourning hair is tightly woven and placed in a locket, pin or a frame. This piece here is certainly different. It is a small lock of hair that is tied at the tip and placed in this pendant. I was told that the photo of the young woman is who's lock of hair is in this pendant. Sorry, I love vintage photographs so it is not going to be jointing the necklace. If you have not heard of mourning hair art or the art of mourning please check out a blog entry i did a whole back on it. http://www.lemoderntrinket.com/2010/04/15/mourning-hair-art/

Everything on this piece is vintage. Event the lobster claw. The chain is made of found rosary parts, beads and watch parts. Thank you for looking. 


Thank you for looking.


If you are in the Orange County area or Los Angeles you can find my trinkets at Seed Peoples Market, Rothick Art Haus Gallery and Rumble Ruse and in Echo Park (LA) at Luxe De Ville. You can also check out current events, shows and pieces on my Facebook, Twitter and website. Thank you for checking out my page. 

LMT also does commission pieces. Follow me on Twitter, Instagram, Flickr, FB, Tumblr & Pinterest.

name: Turn me well - Skeleton up-cycled vintage earrings.
description:
If you are in the Orange County area or Los Angeles you can find my trinkets at Seed Peoples Market, Rothick Art Haus Gallery and Rumble Ruse and in Echo Park (LA) at Luxe De Ville. You can also check out current events, shows and pieces on my Facebook, Twitter and website. Thank you for checking out my page. 
These are a pair of earrings I made using vintage skeleton keys. They measure 4" in length and are not very heavy. I am mindful of all of my earrings to make sure that they are not heavy. We ladies do not want to have pre-maturesaggy ear lobes. 

If you have nay questions please contact me.

name: Repurposed vintage pocket watch pendant necklace w/ watch gears
description:
This necklace has been made using found objects. A vintage ladies pocket watch repurposed into a pendant with watch gears dangling from its base. All items are vintage and make for a perfect gift for that gal that digs all things vintage!

The pocket watch has age to it with some cracks and a little break which gives it character on its plastic case in which covers the watch movement. The pocket watch has an Art Deco vibe to it while the chain in which it dangles off of has a Mod look.

If you are in the Orange County area or Los Angeles you can find my trinkets at Seed Peoples Market, Rothick Art Haus Gallery and Rumble Ruse and in Echo Park (LA) at Luxe De Ville. name: Art Deco Up-cycled vintage Mourning pin ring
description:
With my love for odd things like mourning art and jewelry I recently made this up-cycled mourning pin into a ring. For more information about mourning jewelry and mourning hair art read more on a blog entry I posted some time ago. http://www.lemoderntrinket.com/2010/04/15/mourning-hair-art/

With an adjustable band anyone can wear this. It has a silver finish and is NOT made of silver.
I have tested these bands out often and they do not turn the fingers green. PLEASE DO NOT GET THIS WET! 

Thanks for looking :) 

LMT also does commission pieces. Follow me on Twitter, Instagram, Flickr, FB, Tumblr & Pinterest.

name: Found Objects and readymades repurposed vintage pocket watch rings. Industrial steampunk couture
description:
I have recently been dabbling with the backings of pocket watches and finding other uses for them. Up-cycling many into rings, necklaces and earrings. Here I have a series of these rings. There are a total of 8 right now and not one is the same yet individually unique. The band is adjustable. 

Perfect for both the ladies and the gents.

LMT also does commission pieces. Follow me on Twitter, Instagram, Flickr, FB, Tumblr & Pinterest. Also check out my Etsy shop http://www.etsy.com/shop/LeModernTrinket
